metadata.synopsis: The player comes across Mol and Raphael playing a game of lanceboard (Forgotten Realms chess). The devil is clearly beating Mol, but with the player's help, she can win.Cinematic Notes: Mol and Raphael are sitting down throughout this entire scene. Raphael teleports out of his seat at the end and is no longer on screen.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Walk up to Mol and Raphael in the Tavern.

7.speaker: Raphael
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael watches in cold amusement as Mol grips one of the pieces, clearly anxious.NodeContext: Says the cat to the mouse

49.speaker: Mol
49.text: You trapped me. I didn't even want to take this one.

199.speaker: Raphael
199.text: Calimshan rules, dear. The first piece touched is the first piece moved.

82.speaker: Mol
82.text: That's garbage. No matter where the knight goes, I'm gonna lose it.

179.speaker: Raphael
179.text: Then make the sacrifice useful. Guard your Mystra, or come for my Cyric.
179.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, happening upon Raphael and Mol (tween crime lord) playing chess together.

95.speaker: Player
95.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, happening upon Raphael and Mol (tween crime lord) playing chess together.

198.speaker: Karlach
198.context: NodeContext: Suspicious, happening upon Raphael and Mol (tween crime lord) playing chess together.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: Oh, hey. I remember you. Booked it from the grove before the druids could kick us.
193.context: NodeContext: Not particularly happy to see the player.

110.speaker: Mol
110.text: Oh, hey. I remember you. Booked it from the grove before the druids could kick us.
110.context: NodeContext: Not particularly happy to see the player.

201.speaker: Mol
201.text: Smart. You smart enough for lanceboard? It's my first time playing.

96.speaker: Mol
96.text: Hey! What's a big hero like you doing in a dustheap like this?
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: <pre> Mol's face goes intense with concentration. She notices being watched by the player, and smiles, surprised.

61.speaker: Mol
61.text: Look who made it! For once I saved your butt out there, didn't I? We're square now, chief.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: <pre> Mol's face goes intense with concentration. She notices being watched by the player, and smiles, surprised.NodeContext: Mischievous and pleased with herself.

83.speaker: Mol
83.text: Say, do you play lanceboard by any chance? It's my first time playing.
83.context: NodeContext: Dropping her voice, a little soft and conspiratorial.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: *The keen gleam in Mol's eyes reveals the lie. She knows the game well, and she wants to win.*
181.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

213.text: *The keen gleam in Mol's eyes reveals the lie. She knows the game well, and she wants to win.*
213.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *The keen gleam in Mol's eyes reveals the lie. She knows the game well, and she wants to win.*
31.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: He's laid a fine trap for you, Mol. But it looks to me like his Cyric could be dethroned.
127.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

108.speaker: Gale
108.text: He's laid a fine trap for you, Mol. But it looks to me like his Cyric could be dethroned.
108.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Gale's right. Put pressure on him. Attack the pieces in front of his Cyric.
80.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Gale's right. Put pressure on him. Attack the pieces in front of his Cyric.
89.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Fall back. Protect your queen above everything else.
206.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: That's... certainly another strategy. A losing one, but a strategy nonetheless.
57.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

173.speaker: Gale
173.text: That's... certainly another strategy. A losing one, but a strategy nonetheless.
173.context: NodeContext: Thinks you made a bad decision. Knows what's coming - Mol is about to lose. He may or may not have suggested you take a specific alternative strategy.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: You should be more careful who you listen to. Retreat begets regret. Always.
171.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol moves the piece back. Raphael raises a brow in disapproval

93.text: You should be more careful who you listen to. Retreat begets regret. Always.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol moves the piece back. Raphael raises a brow in disapproval

58.text: You should be more careful who you listen to. Retreat begets regret. Always.
58.context: NodeContext: Happy the player made Mol choose the wrong move. Arrogantly superior.

100.speaker: Raphael
100.text: You should be more careful who you listen to. Retreat begets regret. Always.
100.context: NodeContext: Happy the player made Mol choose the wrong move. Arrogantly superior.

209.speaker: Player
209.text: You shouldn't be playing games with this man. He's a devil.

27.speaker: Mol
27.text: Sure, and I'm Zariel's firstborn. Don't be distractin' me.

53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol hastily moves the piece in her hand to another square.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Put pressure on him. Attack the pieces in front of his king.
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, moving her piece forward and snagging one of Raphael's pawns.

169.text: My, the Theskan Double Counter-Gambit. Vicious. Exactly what I would have done.
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, moving her piece forward and snagging one of Raphael's pawns.

187.text: My, the Theskan Double Counter-Gambit. Vicious. Exactly what I would have done.

37.speaker: Raphael
37.text: My, the Theskan Double Counter-Gambit. Vicious. Exactly what I would have done.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Sorry, kid. I've never played lanceboard.
149.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player knocks the board a bit obviously. When the pieces fall, Raphael's eyes narrow.

52.speaker: Mol
52.text: Pfft. Guess no one's good at everything.

86.speaker: Player
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player knocks the board a bit obviously. When the pieces fall, Raphael's eyes narrow.

189.speaker: Raphael
189.text: Oh dear, aren't we clumsy? Let me put these back in place.
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player knocks the board a bit obviously. When the pieces fall, Raphael's eyes narrow.

98.text: Oh dear, aren't we clumsy? Let me put these back in place.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player knocks the board a bit obviously. When the pieces fall, Raphael's eyes narrow.

124.text: Oh dear, aren't we clumsy? Let me put these back in place.
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player knocks the board a bit obviously. When the pieces fall, Raphael's eyes narrow.

188.speaker: Raphael
188.text: Oh dear, aren't we clumsy? Let me put these back in place.
188.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael sets the pieces back in place.NodeContext: It's obvious he realises the player tried to cheat on behalf of Mol.

106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol and Raphael exchange pieces, ending the game as he captures her king.

220.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol and Raphael exchange pieces, ending the game as he captures her king.

160.speaker: Mol
160.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol's face collapses in disappointment.

139.speaker: Raphael
139.context: NodeContext: smug, but with a threatening undertone

101.speaker: Raphael
101.text: You came close, though. All you needed was a dash more courage.

168.speaker: Raphael
168.text: You will remember that, won't you, when you consider my offer?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Rig the game with some sleight of hand.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player jostles the board, knocking several pieces over. When Raphael's eyes flicker to the player, Mol quickly sets the pieces back up - with a change or two.

36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player jostles the board, knocking several pieces over. When Raphael's eyes flicker to the player, Mol quickly sets the pieces back up - with a change or two.

12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol and Raphael exchange pieces, ending the game when she knocks his king over.

40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol and Raphael exchange pieces, ending the game when she knocks his king over.

151.speaker: Raphael
151.text: Brava! Lovely work. I see I was right to make you the offer I did.
151.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, then folds the pieces into the landboard to put them away, disappearing out of view. When Raphael is centered on screen again, he is standing and smiling at the player.

94.speaker: Raphael
94.text: You will consider it, won't you?
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, then folds the pieces into the landboard to put them away, disappearing out of view. When Raphael is centered on screen again, he is standing and smiling at the player.

74.text: What a lovely specimen she is. A blushing apple, begging to be plucked.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mol nods, then folds the pieces into the landboard to put them away, disappearing out of view. When Raphael is centered on screen again, he is standing and smiling at the player.

1.text: What a lovely specimen she is. A blushing apple, begging to be plucked.
1.context: NodeContext: Raphael called Mol a 'blushing apple' and Karlach is not amused at all. Through gritted teeth, to the player (Raphael won't respond to this)

141.speaker: Raphael
141.text: What a lovely specimen she is. A blushing apple, begging to be plucked.
141.context: NodeContext: Raphael called Mol a 'blushing apple' and Karlach is not amused at all. Through gritted teeth, to the player (Raphael won't respond to this)

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Please let me smack this creep.
137.context: NodeContext: Raphael called Mol a 'blushing apple' and Karlach is not amused at all. Through gritted teeth, to the player (Raphael won't respond to this)

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: Please let me smack this creep.
22.context: NodeContext: Raphael called Mol a 'blushing apple' and Karlach is not amused at all. Through gritted teeth, to the player (Raphael won't respond to this)

41.speaker: Player
41.text: She might have won, you know - if you hadn't made her retreat.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

192.speaker: Raphael
192.text: She might have won, you know - if you hadn't made her retreat.
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

46.speaker: Raphael
46.text: She might have won, you know - if you hadn't made her retreat.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

25.speaker: Raphael
25.text: Indeed. There's no telling where life will lead us - into the Hells, out of them again...

84.speaker: Player
84.text: It's in her best interest to retreat from a devil.

152.speaker: Raphael
152.text: Look outside. There's no one else for her to run to.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Is that why you're here? To play games?

161.speaker: Raphael
161.text: To play the game. The vast lanceboard of souls.

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Just bugger off back to Hell, would you?

138.speaker: Raphael
138.text: Hell is wherever I take it. I just call it Hope, remember?

150.speaker: Raphael
150.text: Her victory was hollow, of course. Frankly, I expected better of you - did Mol ask to have your god win the game for her?
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

38.speaker: Player
38.text: A god is quite handy when dealing with devils.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

91.speaker: Raphael
91.text: Oh, I promise on every treasure I own... you've never dealt with a devil like me before.
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: he leans in with a wicked, knowing grinNodeContext: with a wicked, knowing grin

207.speaker: Raphael
207.text: I noticed your little trick, by the way. You should trust Mol - she never asked for your god to interfere in the game.
207.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I'll not take lessons on morality from a devil, thanks.

19.speaker: Raphael
19.text: Morality? No. The lesson is rather more about autonomy - not some you zealous types know much of.

131.speaker: Raphael
131.text: She might have won, you know - if you hadn't been so hell-bent on exposing my truer nature.
131.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

148.speaker: Player
148.text: Someone's gotta look out for her.

197.speaker: Raphael
197.text: A pity no one did the same for you, all those years ago.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: She has a right to know your truer nature.

59.speaker: Raphael
59.text: She'd never take your word for it - not with my angelic complexion.

118.speaker: Raphael
118.text: She might have won, you know. There was no need for your attempt at sabotage.
118.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

102.speaker: Raphael
102.text: I'm afraid you'll find me more difficult to ruffle than that.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I had a feeling the odds weren't in her favour.

134.speaker: Raphael
134.text: She cheated, of course, but that's half her charm.
134.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Leave her alone. I'm warning you.

32.speaker: Raphael
32.text: Oh please, Karlach. Let us abandon this cack-handed attempt at solving your problems by fixing hers.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: And what is the other half?

66.speaker: Raphael
66.text: The Theskan move suggestion was inspired. I had no idea you played.
66.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Beating devils brings out the best in me.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: There's plenty about me you have no idea about.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: A list of my many hidden talents would stretch to Avernus and back.

143.speaker: Raphael
143.text: I can most certainly believe it.

54.speaker: Raphael
54.text: She might have won, you know - with a little push in the right direction.
54.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

163.speaker: Player
163.text: I figured the girl could handle herself.
163.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

9.speaker: Raphael
9.text: Just like yourself - isn't that right?
9.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

204.speaker: Raphael
204.text: But don't you worry about Mol - it goes without saying she still has the unconditional freedom to choose the only option she has left.
204.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Now, let's talk about you. I sense there's something you want to ask me.
60.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

113.speaker: Raphael
113.text: Now, let's talk about you. I sense there's something you want to ask me.
113.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

104.speaker: Astarion
104.text: I do. I have a proposal for you.
104.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

24.speaker: Raphael
24.text: A proposal? If you're hoping to taste my blood, little vampling, think again. It burns hotter than Wyvern Whiskey.
24.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

70.speaker: Astarion
70.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

81.speaker: Astarion
81.text: My old - well, a long time ago, someone carved infernal runes into my back. They are a fragment of a contract. I'd like to know what the full contract says.
81.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: My old - well, a long time ago, someone carved some runes into my back. I'd rather like to know what they say.
63.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

65.speaker: Raphael
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: What are you talking about, Astarion? What scars?
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

5.speaker: Raphael
5.text: You haven't told them? And you've kept your clothes on this whole time? How unlike you.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

123.speaker: Raphael
123.text: Why not let them see? Don't be shy.
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

43.context: NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

153.speaker: Astarion
153.context: NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

146.speaker: Raphael
146.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

45.speaker: Raphael
45.text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? I could have helped.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? I could have helped.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: I - perhaps I should have. I'm not exactly used to asking for help and being met with, well... help.

202.speaker: Astarion
202.text: But what's done is done, so how about we stop talking about it and just get on with things?

191.speaker: Astarion
191.text: Although I should probably get dressed first...

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Gods... the carving must have been excruciating.

176.speaker: Astarion
176.text: Cazador worked on it from dusk until dawn, all with an ancient blade he called his 'needle'. Cutting and tearing, starting over if I screamed or winced too much.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: All I know is you have us doing odd jobs for a devil.

214.speaker: Astarion
214.text: It could be infinitely worse. We seem to be rather good at killing things.

223.speaker: Astarion
223.text: Let's just go. Standing here chatting gets us nowhere.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: Don't play games, Raphael. Help him out.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: This is a bad idea, Astarion. We should find another way.

159.speaker: Raphael
159.text: It's something very important to your master. But is it a love letter, a warning, or a deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

2.speaker: Raphael
2.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

145.speaker: Astarion
145.text: You'll 'get back' to me? This is important, devil. When?

210.speaker: Raphael
210.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

30.speaker: Raphael
30.text: Besides, I do enjoy being in this neighbourhood again. It has such a rich history of abject tragedy.

170.speaker: Raphael
170.text: And tragedy, my friend, well there's my bread and bloody butter.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Speaking of bloody - the scars on my back. Can you tell me what they mean?

119.speaker: Player
119.text: So what is this region's history of tragedy?

14.speaker: Raphael
14.text: Why spoil it? It's all out there, waiting to be discovered.

72.speaker: Raphael
72.text: You never know what you might find if you just... dig a little deeper.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Just stay away from Mol, you hear?

115.speaker: Raphael
115.text: She won. She has a taste for it now. She'll be the one who comes to me.

55.speaker: Raphael
55.text: But enough about my lesser pursuits. Why bother with trifles when I'm in the illustrious presence of my very favourite client!

166.speaker: Raphael
166.text: Tell me, O apple of my eye, how have you been? You don't have any gills to get green around yet, but you do look a bit worse for wear in this light.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: I want to know about the scars on my back. What do they mean?

183.speaker: Raphael
183.text: But of course, those curious little marks. Something important to your master, no doubt, but what?

6.speaker: Raphael
6.text: A love letter? A warning? A deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

111.speaker: Raphael
111.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

51.speaker: Raphael
51.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Might be the infernal engine in my chest.

34.speaker: Raphael
34.text: Poor Karlach. She really suffers so terribly, death haranguing her from every angle. But it hasn't struck yet, has it?

35.speaker: Raphael
35.text: In fact, I'm quite confident you still have a few good days in you yet. Precious time to practise begging for my help with your bare knees in the dirt.

116.speaker: Raphael
116.text: I really am at my magnanimous best when people make an effort.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: If you're still offering solutions, I'm all ears.

42.speaker: Raphael
42.text: All thumbs, rather, the way you've been stumbling about the place. But at least I can't say I'm not entertained.

217.speaker: Player
217.text: You know, I've never been better.

125.speaker: Raphael
125.text: I have this picture in my head - of you tossing and turning in the middle of the night, thinking strange things, dreaming strange dreams.

4.speaker: Raphael
4.text: And there's this little voice inside of you asking: 'Is this my will, or is it the worm's?' But you have no answer, and no way of knowing.

3.speaker: Raphael
3.text: The good thing is, though, there's only one little voice you really should listen to.

155.speaker: Raphael
155.text: She lost. She is lost. It's only a matter of time before the apple is plucked.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I can't resist a good tragedy. Indulge me - what happened here?

136.speaker: Raphael
136.text: Come now, you'd have me tell you? Spoil all the fun?

16.speaker: Raphael
16.text: Suffice to say there's ambition, folly, and death aplenty. The rest... well. I'll let you uncover that yourself.

15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears, leaving behind nothing but an empty table.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: A little push away from you is exactly the right direction.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: Calimshan fell because its nobility got cocky. Put pressure on his king.
144.context: NodeContext: Looking down, considering - suddenly victorious

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Why would I play a game that imitates war when I can fight any time I want?
47.context: NodeContext: Looking down, considering - suddenly victorious

219.speaker: Player
219.text: This is a game that tests your mind. Look at the board with fresh eyes - what does your opponent hide?
219.context: NodeContext: Looking down, considering - suddenly victorious

99.speaker: Mol
99.text: Hmm. A-ha - his king is wide open!
99.context: NodeContext: Looking down, considering - suddenly victorious

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Of course I play. No better way to learn battle strategy than lanceboard. It's fun, too.

90.speaker: Mol
90.text: Didn't ask for your life story - I asked if you could play. What's the next move?

71.speaker: Player
71.text: You win by taking the king - attack it at all costs. The Vanquisher's Lance stratagem.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: He's set up a clever little trap. But... his Cyric looks rather open, don't you think?

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Exactly what I was about to suggest.

105.speaker: Gale
105.text: Exactly what I was about to suggest.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Say you don't want to interfere and pray for your god to guide Mol's hand.

177.speaker: Gale
177.text: I see that glint in your eyes. You've a strategy in mind. The same one as me, I'd wager.
